CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 2, 1958, page A13, reads: "A 'Queen' is Crowned - Mrs. Elaine Mitchell (seated) is being crowned by Mrs. Beatrice Stewart (second from left) as the inner in 'King or Queen for a Day' program sponsored by the 20th District, Fifth Ward, Community Club. The contest was staged at Addison Hall on July 25. Others in the picture are, left to right: Mrs. Ollie Brown, Mrs. Stewart, Addison Dukes, president, and Mary Howard, chairman. Walter Wilson, not shown, is a member of the club, also. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Nineteen women, including four front center, left to right: Elaine Mitchell crowning Beatrice Stewart, holding large bouquet of gladiolus, Mrs.Ollie Brown, and Mary Howard, and two men, including Addison Dukes on right, gathered in gymnasium at Addison Hall, Terrace Village, for the 'King or Queen for a Day' program sponsored by the 20th District, Fifth Ward, Community Club
